content.question: The authors’ argument in the third paragraph concerning the effect of “social factors” on the effectiveness of a country’s healthcare system likely refers to all of the following general trends in the twentieth century EXCEPT

choices.label: the high likelihood that a literate population would follow medical advice regarding vaccinations and child healthcare
the high likelihood that improvements in gender equality would lead to adoption of modern family-planning techniques
the high likelihood that rising educational levels would lead to the adoption of healthier lifestyles
the high likelihood that increasing longevity would lead to an increase in overall healthcare costs

content.answer: the high likelihood that increasing longevity would lead to an increase in overall healthcare costs

topic.text: 9.2: Technological Advances and Limitations after 1900 - Disease

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
